title: Supplemental Materials Molecular Biology of the Cell
body:
Part of a Vps34p phosphatidylinositol 3kinase complex that functions in carboxypeptidase Y (CPY) sorting; binds Vps30p and Vps34p to promote production of phosphatidylinositol 3phosphate (PtdIns3P) which stimulates kinase activity Identified in VPL screen that mislocalizes vacuolar proteins to the cell surface (Rothman et al., 1989) UVRAG (Itakura et al., 2008) 1 0.97

Involved in targeting carboxypeptidase Y (CPY) and mutant Pma1 to the vacuole (Luo and Chang, 1997) Mediates interaction between Vps30 and Vps34-Vps14 -PI3K complex II (Kihara et al., 2001) Involved in targeting CPY and not Pma1 or CPS, Vps5 and Vps17 (retromer) bind PI3P via PX domain (Burda et al., 2002) 2 VPS36

Component of the ESCRT-II complex; contains the GLUE (GRAM Like Ubiquitin binding in EAP45) domain which is involved in interactions with ESCRT-I and ubiquitin-dependent sorting of proteins into the endosome Identified in VPL screen that mislocalizes vacuolar proteins to the cell surface, forms class E compartment, (Rothman et al., 1989) EAP45/VPS36 (Kamura et al., 2001) 0.86 0.58

Identified in screen that led to increased alkaline phosphatase (ALP) in the vacuole, increased CPY secretion, (Nothwehr et al., 1996) Forms a complex with Vps36 and Vps22 by gel filtration, associates with endosomes by fluorescent microscopy, release from membranes is Vps4 dependent, functions downstream of ESCRTI and binds to ESCRTIII (Babst et al., 2002b) Crystal structure of quaternary ESCRT II complex shows stoichiometry of 2:1:1 of Vps25:Vps22:Vps36, hydrophobic patch of Y441, L97, I100, L141 important for binding to Vps22, disruption of complex leads to class E phenotype, D548 forms (Hierro et al., 2004) a salt bridge with R83 of Vps25, Crystal structure of quaternary ESCRT II complex shows stoichiometry of 2:1:1 of Vps25:Vps22:Vps36, four salt links with Vps22, ESCRTII interacts with Vps20 (ESCRTIII) which increases binding of ESCRTIII to membranes in vitro (Teo et al., 2004) Identified as a suppressor of cdc1-1, suppression due to accumulation of Smf1, conferred sensitivity to Li+ and Ca2+ (Eguez et al., 2004) The N-terminal GLUE domain interact with the C-terminus of Vps28 by gel filtration and coimmunoprecipitation, ESCRTII complex binds to Folch lipid vesicles mediated by the GLUE domain which contains a PH domain, GLUE domain localizes ESCRTII to endosomes, Vps36 NZF domain binds ubiquitin (Teo et al., 2006) 3 DID2

Class E protein of the vacuolar protein-sorting (Vps) pathway; binds Vps4p and directs it to dissociate ESCRT-III complexes; forms a functional and physical complex with Ist1p; human ortholog may be altered in breast tumors Class A (wild-type) vacuoles in vacuole morphology study (Raymond et al., 1992) CHMP1 (Howard et al., 2001 )-CHMP1A CHMP1B (Tsang et al., 2006) 0.46 0.07

Identified as a suppressor of doa4 mutant, characterized similar to Vps46, localizes to class E compartment when Vps4/Did6 ATPase is defective (Amerik et al., 2000) Did2 coordinates Vps4mediated dissociation of ESCRT-III from endosomes (Nickerson et al., 2006) Ist1, Did2, Vta1, and Vps60 Function Together to Positively Modulate Cargo Sorting, Did2 recruits Ist1 to endosomes (Rue et al., 2008) 4 GIM4

Subunit of the heterohexameric cochaperone prefoldin complex which binds specifically to cytosolic chaperonin and transfers target proteins to it

Synthetically lethal with TUB4, deletion is osmotically sensitive (Geissler et al., 1998) PFD2 (Vainberg et al., 1998) 0.45 0.04

Part of prefoldin complex that binds chaperonin (Vainberg et al., 1998) Synthetically lethal with STU1 (Brew and Huffaker, 2002) 5 VPS22

Component of the ESCRT-II complex, which is involved in ubiquitin-dependent sorting of proteins into the endosome; appears to be functionally related to SNF7; involved in glucose derepression Identified in VPT screen which led to increased secretion of CPYinvertase fusion protein, (Robinson et al., 1988) EAP30 (Schmidt et al., 1999) 0.40 0.54

Identified in VPL screen that mislocalizes vacuolar proteins to the cell surface (Rothman et al., 1989) Identified in mutagenesis screen for inability to grow on raffinose (Vallier and Carlson, 1991) (Rothman and Stevens, 1986) CHMP2a (Fujita et al., 2004) 0.36 0.37

Identified in screen for defective endocytosis of STE3 (Davis et al., 1993) Identified in screen that led to increased ALP in the vacuole, increased CPY secretion, (Nothwehr et al., 1996) Identified in VPT screen which led to increased secretion of CPYinveratase fusion protein, (Robinson et al., 1988) Identified as a suppressor of doa4 mutant, characterized similar to vps46, localizes to class E compartment when vps4/Did6 ATPase is defective (Amerik et al., 2000) Forms ESCRTIII complex with Vps20, vVs24 and snf7 by fractionation and colocalization, forms a subcomplex with vps24 (Babst et al., 2002a) 7 LDB16

Protein of unknown function; null mutants have decreased net negative cell surface charge; GFP-fusion protein expression is induced in response to the DNA-damaging agent MMS; native protein is detected in purified mitochondria

Screen of ldb phenotype that is associated with reduced incorporation of mannosyl phosphate groups into the mannoprotein-linked oligosaccharides (Corbacho et al., 2005) none 0.35 0 Mitochondria proteomics (Reinders et al., 2006) Microarray reveals at least three fold increase in response to DNA damage (MMS) Removal of promoter produces weak Opi phenotype (Hancock et al., 2006) (Rothman et al., 1989) Tsg101 (Li et al., 1999) 0.31 0.67

Deletion rescues mating defect of stp2 mutant, localizes to class E compartment (Li et al., 1999) Cloned by complementation, interacts with vps28, CPS misprocessing suggests endosomal function (Babst et al., 2000) Characterization of ESCRT1 (Vps23,28,37), binds ubiquitinated cargo (Katzmann et al., 2001) 9 VPS35

Endosomal subunit of membrane-associated retromer complex required for retrograde transport; receptor that recognizes retrieval signals on cargo proteins, forms subcomplex with Vps26p and Vps29p that selects cargo proteins for retrieval; interacts with Ypt7p

Identified in VPT screen which led to increased secretion of CPYinvertase fusion protein (Bankaitis et al., 1986; Robinson et al., 1988) Vps35 (Zhang, 2000) 0.29 0.99

Identified in screen that led to increased ALP in the vacuole, increased CPY secretion (Nothwehr et al., 1996) Dominant negative is rescued by overexpression of Vps29, fractionates with Vps29, required for assembly of the complex, forms a subcomplex with Vps26 and Vps29, primarily membrane bound, deletion causes disruption of Vps29 membrane association, crosslinking experiment pulls down rest of retromer (Seaman et al., 1998) Crosslinks with A-ALP, used to examine retromer sorting signal (Nothwehr et al., 2000) 10 VPS5

Nexin-1 homolog required for localizing membrane proteins from a prevacuolar/late endosomal Identified in VPT screen which led to increased secretion of CPYinveratase fusion protein, (Bankaitis et al., 1986; Robinson et al., 1988) SNX1 (Nothwehr, 1997) (Raymond et al., 1992) 2009) Identified in screen that led to increased ALP in the vacuole, increased CPY secretion, mutant has growth defect at 37°C (Nothwehr et al., 1996) Crosslinking experiment pulls down rest of retromer, is able to self assemble, (Seaman et al., 1998) 11 GOS1 (Pan et al., 2000) none 0.14 0.02 Localizes to cytoplasm in punctate pattern (Huh et al., 2003) Vab2 interacts with members of the BLOC-1 complex (sorts cargo to lysosome related organelles) reviewed in (Hayes et al., 2011) 18 PKR1 V-ATPase assembly factor; functions with other V-ATPase assembly factors in the ER to efficiently assemble the V-ATPase membrane sector (V0); protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress Deletion causes growth defect on low iron media due to Fet3 (iron transporter) activity at the plasma membrane, vacuole ATPase decreased in deletion preventing vacuole acidification, ER localized (Davis-Kaplan et al., 2006) none 0.14 0.47

Vacuolar protein component of the retromer; forms part of the multimeric membrane-associated retromer complex involved in vacuolar protein sorting along Identified in VPT screen which led to increased secretion of CPYinveratase fusion protein (Bankaitis et al., 1986; Robinson et al., 1988) VPS26A, VPS26B (Kerr et al., 2005) 0.14 1 Identified in screen that led to increased ALP in the vacuole, increased CPY secretion, (Nothwehr et al., 1996) with Vps35p, Vps29p, Vps17p, and Vps5p; essential for endosometo-Golgi retrograde protein transport; interacts with Ypt7p; protein abundance increases in response to DNA replication stress Crosslinking experiment pulls down rest of retromer, mislocalizes Vps10 similar to other retromer components, forms a subcomplex with Vps29 and Vps35 (Seaman et al., 1998) (Eitzen et al., 2000) 27 ECM30

Putative protein of unknown function; may play a role in cell wall biosynthesis, mutants have abnormal relative levels of mannose and glucose and have Gap1p sorting and Transposon mutagenesis screen on calcaphlor white decreased mannose/glucose levels (Lussier et al., 1997) none 0.083 0.01 Localizes to the cytoplasm (Huh et al., 2003) Forms a complex with Ubp15 that regulates (Costanzo et al., 2010) transport defects; (GFP)-fusion protein localizes to the cytoplasm Gap1 plasma membrane localization 28 ARL1

Soluble GTPase with a role in regulation of membrane traffic; regulates potassium influx; G protein of the Ras superfamily, similar to ADPribosylation factor Identified using degenerate PCR, mutant and overexpression have growth defects, is a myristolated protein that localize to Golgi membranes, (Lee et al., 1997) ARL1 (Lee et al., 1997) 0.081 0.81

Deletion is temperaturesensitive and unable to grow on sucrose suppressed by YPT1, increased CPY secretion (Rosenwald et al., 2002) Deletion is sensitive to hygromyocin which is suppressed by the downstream effectors, Hal4, Hal5, and Sap155, deletion does not alter Trk1 (Munson et al., 2004) 29 YPT6

Rab family GTPase, Ras-like GTP binding protein involved in the secretory pathway, required for fusion of endosome-derived vesicles with the late Golgi, maturation of the vacuolar carboxypeptidase Y; has similarity to the human GTPase, Rab6

Ts mutant leads to decreased transcription of ribosomal genes, deletion is lethal at 37°C, invertase secretion and CPY glycosylation are inhibited in mutants, glycosylation pattern of invertase suggests role in ER-Golgi trafficking, (Li and Warner, 1996) RAB6 (Li and Warner, 1996) 0.078 0.52 Mutants showed defects in Golgi associated glycosylation of CPY, ALP, and invertase; Nlinked glycosylation enzymes are not properly localized in mutants but O-linked and ER glycosylation are, synthetic lethal with sec35 mutant, involved in Golgi/endosomal trafficking (Luo and Gallwitz, 2003) 30 MVB12

ESCRT-I subunit required to stabilize oligomers of the ESCRT-I core complex (Stp22p, Vps28p, Srn2p), which is Colocalizes with ESCRTI by fluorescence and gel filtration, stabilizes interaction of coiled-coil domain of Vps23, (Chu et al., 2006) MVB12A, MVB12B (Seaman, 2008) (Redding et al., 1996) Soi1 encodes a 358kD protein that has homology to a C. elegans protein, immunofluorescence (Brickner and Fuller, 1997) shows altered Kex2 localization in deletion

Relocalizes to the prospore and is required for cytokinesis, deletion leads to decreased phosphatidylinositides at the prospore and increased intralumenal vesicles (Park and Neiman, 2012) 35 (Ram et al., 2002) COG8 (Miller and Ungar, 2012) 0.048 0.49 Homologous to mammalian COG complex (Ungar et al., 2002) in vitro translation studies incorporation is dependent on Cog 5, Cog7, and Cog6 (Loh and Hong, 2004) 

Subunit of phosphatidylinositol (PtdIns) 3-kinase complexes I and II; Complex I is essential in autophagy and Complex II is required for vacuolar protein sorting; ortholog of the higher eukaryotic gene Beclin 1

Identified in a morphological screen for autophagic bodies (Tsukada and Ohsumi, 1993) BECN1/Beclin-1 (Aita et al., 1999) 0.047 1 Deletion secretes CPY and PrA, peripherally associates with the membrane, deletion causes mislocalization of Vps10 by gradient analysis, (Seaman et al., 1997) Identified in VPT screen which led to increased secretion of CPYinveratase fusion protein, weak secretion phenotype (Robinson et al., 1988) Immunoprecipitation shows interaction with vps38 and vps34, deletion secretes CPY and prevents transport of API, autophagy inhibited in deletion, Vps30 binds to Vps368 which then allows binding to Apg14 and Apg15, associates with membranes, (Kihara et al., 2001) Deletion secretes CPY, deletion mislocalizes Kex2 and Vps10, deletion depletes PI3P, which inhibits Vps5 and Vps17 from binding membranes through PX domain (Burda et al., 2002) Identified in a mutagenesis screen for increased A1PiZ, UPR is constitutively active, A1PiZ is targeted to the vacuole in vps30, vps38, vps10 dependent manner for degradation (Kruse et al., 2006) 38 GTR2

Putative GTP binding protein that negatively regulates Ran/Tc4 GTPase cycle; activates transcription; subunit of EGO and GSE complexes; required for sorting of Gap1p; localizes to cytoplasm and to chromatin; homolog of human RagC and RagD homologous to GTR1, rescues cold sensitivity of gtr1-11 strain, GST pulldown shows interaction with GTR1 that is necessary for interaction with itself, suppresses prp20-1 (Nakashima et al., 1999) RAGC, RAGD (Sekiguchi et al., 2001) 0.038 0 Identified in screen for the inability to resume growth following rapamyocin treatment, localized to the vacuolar membrane, involved in microautphagy (Dubouloz et al., 2005) Interacts with GTR1 by yeast two hybrid, deletion decreases Gap1 activity, colocalizes with other GSE complex members on endosomal membranes, GDP bound state has higher Gap1 activity, interaction with Gap1 necessary for internalization (Gao and Kaiser, 2006) Component of the CCR4-NOT transcriptional complex, which is involved in regulation of gene expression; component of the major cytoplasmic deadenylase, which is involved in mRNA poly(A) tail shortening Identified in a screen for regulators of ADHII activity, (Denis, 1984) CCR4/CNOT6 (Dupressoir et al., 2001) (Ungar et al., 2002) in vitro translation studies incorporation is dependent on Cog 5 and Cog7 which is then required for incorporation of Cog8, (Loh and Hong, 2004) 43 COG5

Component of the conserved oligomeric Golgi complex (Cog1p through Cog8p), a cytosolic tethering complex that functions in protein trafficking to mediate fusion of transport vesicles to Golgi compartments Deletion causes growth defect in combination with sec35-1, mobility shift when deleted suggests in a complex with Sec34 and Sec35 (Ram et al., 2002) COG5 (Miller and Ungar, 2012) 0.031 0.35

Homologous to mammalian COG complex (Ungar et al., 2002) in vitro translation studies show direct interaction with Cog4 and Cog7, interaction with Cog7 is required for incorporation of Cog6 which is then required for incorporation of Cog8 (Loh and Hong, 2004) (Mrsa et al., 1993) Hypoosmotic screen revealed overproduciton of BGL2, phenotype complemented by PKC1 (Shimizu et al., 1994) Factor of c. albicans virulence (Sarthy et al., 1997) Deletion of homolog in Aspergillus fumigatus showed no phenotype (Mouyna et al., 1998) a Descriptions from the Saccharomyces Genome Database b Summaries from the literature of select genes involved in trafficking, localization, and stability c Growth Score calculated from doubling times (see Materials and Methods) d CPY secretion score (Schluter et al., 2008) MATα, ade2, his3, leu2, ura3, trp1 (Pagant et al., 2007) hrd1Δ MATα, ade2, his3, leu2, ura3, trp1, hrd1::KANMX (Pagant et al., 2007) doa10Δ MATα, ade2, his3, leu2, ura3, trp1, doa10::KANMX (Pagant et al., 2007) hrd1Δ doa10Δ MATα, ade2, his3, leu2, ura3, trp1, hrd1, doa10 ::KANMX (Pagant et al., 2007) pep4Δ MATα, his3, leu2, ura3, pep4::KANMX Invitrogen pep4Δ pdr5Δ MATα, his3, leu2, ura3, pep4::KANMX, pdr5::KANMX This Lab SSA1 MATα, 15, 112, lys2, , ssa3-1(TRP1), ssa4-2(LYS2), (Becker et al., 1996) ssa1-45 MATα, his3-11,15, leu2-3,112, ura3-52, trp1-Δ1, lys2, ssa1-45, ssa2-1(LEU) , ssa3-1(TRP1), ssa4-2(LYS2), (Becker et al., 1996)
